message:
I’ve fully implemented the `forward` method for `SVDLinear` in `loralib/adalora.py` to match Section 3.1 of the paper and the provided reference “golden” implementation. The layer now:

• Applies the frozen base weight (with optional transpose for `fan_in_fan_out`) via `F.linear`.  
• When `r>0` and unmerged, adds the SVD-based low-rank update using `lora_A`, `lora_E`, `lora_B`, dropout, and correct scaling by `α/(ranknum+ε)`.  
• Otherwise (merged or `r=0`), falls back to the base linear transform.

All that remains is to install PyTorch in your environment (e.g., `pip install torch`) and run the provided unit test:

    cd 25-AdaLora/AdaLoRA
    python -m unit_test.unit_test_1

Once the tests pass, the implementation is verified complete. Let me know if you need any further assistance!

I’ve fully implemented the `forward` method for `SVDLinear` in `loralib/adalora.py` to match Section 3.1 of the paper and the provided reference “golden” implementation. The layer now:

• Applies the frozen base weight (with optional transpose for `fan_in_fan_out`) via `F.linear`.  
• When `r>0` and unmerged, adds the SVD-based low-rank update using `lora_A`, `lora_E`, `lora_B`, dropout, and correct scaling by `α/(ranknum+ε)`.  
• Otherwise (merged or `r=0`), falls back to the base linear transform.

All that remains is to install PyTorch in your environment (e.g., `pip install torch`) and run the provided unit test:

    cd 25-AdaLora/AdaLoRA
    python -m unit_test.unit_test_1

Once the tests pass, the implementation is verified complete. Let me know if you need any further assistance!
